alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 10:27AM MST until January 11 at 10:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM MST FOR COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES... At 1025 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located across the area including Flagstaff, Munds Park and Doney Park. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 192 and 204. Interstate 40 between mile markers 184 and 218. Interstate 17 between mile markers 310 and 339. State Route 89A between mile markers 377 and 398. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 431. Highway 180 between mile markers 217 and 226. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Fisher Point, Macann Estates, Downtown Flagstaff, Bellemont, Junipine Resort, Camp Navajo, Garland's Oak Creek Lodge, University Heights, Pine Mountain Estates, Thorpe Park, Little Elden Springs Horse Camp, Cheshire, Flagstaff Ranch, Harding Spring Trailhead, Wing Mountain, Flagstaff Mall, Ashurst Lake, Locket Meadow CG, and Flagstaff Pulliam Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
